Centre for Criminological and Socio-Legal Studies</depositr>         <depDate date="2002-09-02T00:00:00Z">02 September 2002</depDate>         <distDate date="2003-10-08T00:00:00Z">08 October 2003</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2003-10-08T00:00:00Z">1</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-4581-1" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>1995</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/a79aeaaa-a5c4-4dc8-980a-ba354b23cfd4">ANXIETY</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/9d65b7a1-f253-477a-b902-0108d4942fab">COMMUNITY LIFE</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/e751a113-cf43-4ecd-900e-0327407a87fa">CRIME VICTIMS</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/e2ef029a-e78e-46c5-bf44-d9555de495e7">CRIME</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/cee8e2df-dac8-4df3-886e-de63e5152067">FEAR OF CRIME</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/acfb50ac-ffdd-4d83-87e0-85c677c8e669">GENDER</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/31f0a334-6995-42ee-a8bd-2772749e93a9">INTERVIEWS (DATA COLLECTION)</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/668f6ab3-77a5-4404-8f46-750e2bd9e635">NORTH OF ENGLAND (REGION)</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/c7ff6f7a-606e-4a52-89d2-a58defe16770">PSYCHOLOGY</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/694d0f82-c1bf-4148-a289-8aba19443218">RISK</keyword>         <topcClas>Crime and law enforcement - Law, crime and legal systems</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This research focused on crime and its relation to risk of victimisation and the suggestion that high-risk groups, in particular, young men, report lower fear than low-risk groups, in particular, older women.<br> The notion of anxiety as a mediating influence in the relationship between risk of victimisation and fear of crime was examined. Through a set of face-to-face interviews, the research found that the effect of risk figured prominently in interviewee's accounts of their fear of crime and their previous victimisation. They not only positioned themselves as more or less at risk but more actively were recurrently engaged in more or less 'risky' practices. The research suggests that the relations between risk and fear of crime cannot be understood without theorising the multiple meanings attaching to a person's identity which become invested with anxiety.<br> The data consists of interview transcripts with men and women living on estates where the incidence of crime was either high or low. The interviews aimed to understand the differences in fear of crime among different social groups, integrating demographic characteristics, analyses of gender, ethnicity and age. </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Anxiety; childhood; community life; crime; crime victims; fear of crime; gender; psychoanalysis; risk; violence.<br> <br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="1995-01-01T00:00:00Z">1995</timePrd>         <timePrd> Some interviews contain life history details</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="1995-06-15T00:00:00Z">15 June 1995</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1995-12-14T00:00:00Z">14 December 1995</collDate>         <nation>England</nation>         <geogCover>North of England</geogCover>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>Subnational</universe>         <universe>Men and women aged between 16-76, living on low and high crime estates in the North of England during 1995.</universe>         <dataKind>Textual data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>         <dataKind>in-depth/unstructured interview transcripts</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Purposive selection/case studies</sampProc>         <deviat>36 (obtained)</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply.
